title: The seuenth tragedie of Seneca, entituled Medea: translated out of Latin into English, by Iohn Studley, student in Trinitie Colledge in Cambridge
author: Seneca, Lucius Annaeus, ca. 4 B.C.-65 A.D.
publisher: In Fleetestreate, beneth the Conduit, at the signe of Sainct Iohn Euangelist, by Thomas Colwell,
notes: Running title reads: Medea of Seneca.
Reproduction of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
